text: How does the community feel about Mozilla Public License? I loosely like the idea of copy-left, but I have the impression that GPL is too restrictive and sort of poisons other stuff. Is MPL any better?

text: Personally, I find copyleft to be kinda obnoxious. I appreciate that MPL is less demanding than GPL, but I still just think that if I’m going to write or use open source software, I don’t want it to come with hooks or conditions. I want it to be free.

text: I appreciate copyleft.  Permissive is good too, but I think fsf/gnu definitely have a point.

elements.text: I appreciate copyleft.  Permissive is good too, but I think fsf/gnu definitely have a point.

text:
I should add that I’m not particularly well informed on the history here, but my understanding is that the work fsf / gnu did (which copyleft was central to) was very important to bringing open source to where it is today and I don’t want to discount that. 

But in the landscape we’re in today, I’d rather write and use truly permissive software.
